utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Good gracious, Richard. You look positively ghastly.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning to you, too, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no. I’m speaking as a concerned mother. Are you sure you’re not coming down with anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not at all. Never better.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, well, good! Then my work here is done. I am off to see some open houses, hopefully to find the apartment of my dreams. Ta!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Bye!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ta!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Is Alexis gone too?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. She had an early morning class. So you were restless again last night. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, you keep saying that and it keeps getting worse. You were whimpering in your sleep. It’s been every night for a week. So come on. Talk to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just a dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it’s a recurring dream. Okay. About what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About when I went missing, I think.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … so why didn’t you want to tell me about it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably because I didn’t want to make a big deal of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But it is a big deal. You lost two months of your life and you’re dreaming about it now? I don’t think you should ignore this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do. Come on. Everything is perfect right now. You and I are in a great place. Everyone else is. I mean, why go turning over stones when the dreams will just probably go away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except they haven’t gone away. They’re just getting worse. Look at you. You’re stressed out. You’re exhausted. You haven’t written a word in a week. Look, at least consider seeing someone? I know somebody who may be able to help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you met my mother you’d know the answer would be yes, but uh … by my nature I try to avoid introspection.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Well. Let’s get started. What can you tell me about your missing time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not much. Last thing I remember I was driving to my wedding. A black SUV started chasing me and I was forced off the road. Two months later they found me in the middle of the Atlantic ocean. I had been exposed to dengue fever. I had a bullet scar with no recollection of how I got it. No memory of anything. I tracked down a man named Jenkins who was involved somehow. He uh … he told me the reason I couldn’t remember.

utterance.speaker: HENRY JENKINS
utterance.content: You said you didn’t want to remember. We went to great lengths to make sure that you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: And is it still the case that you don’t want to remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I – I ‘ve tried to put it behind me. But it haunts me. Not a day goes by I don’t wonder where I was, what I saw. What I did. Is it possible my memories are coming back?

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Well, dreams can be memories. But more often they’re symbolic. Metaphoric expressions of an issue or a problem. You’re also a writer, a creative person. This could mean your mind is building a narrative to fill the two month void.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I want to understand these dreams. What they mean and uh … if they’re real.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Well, we could put you in a relaxed state. Try to revisit the experience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hypnosis?

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: You have a pen and paper if you wish to take notes. You may open your eyes and awaken at any time. Are you ready to begin, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Go back to the first image you can recall of your dream. What do you see?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m asleep on a boat. In the ocean. There’s a man there. He says hi to me. He knows me.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Do you know him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s familiar, but I can’t … place him. Wow. This really works. Okay, there’s something familiar. A trophy.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: For some kind of sport?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe. I can’t tell. Now someone’s firing a pistol. I see blood. There’s a man on the floor. He’s been shot. He’s dying. I’m there, too. I’m wearing camouflage paint. I’m trying to help him, but …

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Can you see where you are right now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In a storage shed. But it seems like everything is moving. I’m in a truck. We’re in the jungle. And … there’s someone chasing us. They’re shooting at us. There’s a blond man in the truck. He’s leading the charge.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: A military truck?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s a civilian truck but it has a very … strange license plate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: So the man you saw was Chuck Norris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, he wasn’t – – Chuck Norris. Of course not. That’d be ridiculous and … super-duper cool, but no. He looked like Chuck Norris.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Well. This was a very productive first session, Mr. Castle, but I’m afraid our time is up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Thank you. Uh, Dr. Burke, can I – can I see you again tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Well, I’ll check. But I want you to think about the underlying meaning of the dream. Now, don’t assume that the images are actual memories.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m telling you guys. There’s no doubt in my mind. They are actual memories.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even though Dr. Burke said they might not be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That – it was our first session. He was just being cautious. But they felt real. Because they are real.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you were in jungle combat? With Chuck Norris?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Like Missing in Action, the movie he did about rescuing POWs from Vietnam?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, only it wasn’t Chuck Norris, it wasn’t a movie, and I wasn’t in Vietnam.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got that right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because the license plate, the one Tory is checking out? It had Arabic characters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so an Arabic speaking country with a jungle. Um … Yemen, Somalia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess so. We’ll know more when we track down that Chuck Norris lookalike.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How do you plan on doing that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The military skull tattoo I told you about. That could help ID him, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll see what we can find out. But it’s a long shot. At best.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know this seems impossible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A lot of our cases do at first. There’s something there, Castle, so we’ll just follow it and see where it leads.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: I got something on that license plate.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: It turns out, this isn’t Arabic. These are letters in the Thai alphabet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does it mean?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: That the license plate was registered in Chiang Mai, a province in northern Thailand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was in Thailand getting shot at with Chuck Norris?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate? Kate, are you awake?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alexis, hey. Um … what’s – what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sorry. I have an exam but I didn’t want to leave Dad like this. He’s kind of gone off the deep end about Thailand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Were you up all night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m uh … researching armed conflicts in northern Thailand during the time I was missing. Somehow I must have been part of one of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You find anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Not yet. But I will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to take a break? Get some breakfast?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Not until I figure this out. I was there, Kate. I was there. I was shot at, which explains my bullet scar. I was exposed to dengue fever, a disease that’s prevalent in the region. Everything fits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But, Castle, why would you be abducted on our wedding day and end up in Thailand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Worst bachelor party ever?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe Dr. Burke is right. Maybe those images you saw in your dream are not really your memories.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh no, they’re memories. They’re memories. And he said follow them wherever they go and this is where they go. Thailand. This is all about Thailand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, why don’t we take a step back from Thailand. Why don’t we take a look at some of the other images. Like the … the trophy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah. The trophy’s irrelevant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it was in your dream for a reason. You said it was familiar. In what way? What did it look like?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheap. You know, something that you would give a child.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. So could it have been an award that Alexis won? Maybe something that you won? Something for writing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know what it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is it. This is the trophy. This is – I um… I won this in a – in a debate competition at Faircroft Prep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would that be in your dream?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but … wait a minute. Phillip Bartlett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s Phillip Bartlett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Phillip Bartlett and I, we tied for first place. We shared this trophy. That man in my dream, the one who says hello, it was him. I mean, he’s my age now, but - Phillip Bartlett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s a part of this. If I’m going to track him down I’m going to need you to do a background check on him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So now it’s Chuck Norris and some old buddy from high school?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, guys. I’m just asking you to run Phil Bartlett. Look, Castle needs to know what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What if these leads go nowhere?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then he needs to know that as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Tory! Hey. Any more news on that license plate?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: A little. The plate was registered to a Thai freight company that went out of business in 1987.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 1987? How would Castle see it on a truck almost thirty years later?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s possible the plate was stolen, or …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or what?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I ran an image search of the plate. Similar license plates appeared in several action films during car chase sequences.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, so … you think he might have seen it in a film.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha. Hey. What’s – what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard is completely obsessed and I am concerned about him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know. Me too.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He never spoke to me about the missing time. I thought he was at peace with it. Didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I guess the dreams made him realize that he wasn’t at peace.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He chose to forget those two months. He must have had a very good reason for wanting to do that. I think looking into this is a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, I – I don’t think this is a choice for him. I think that he needs to know the truth.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What if he never finds out the truth? What if he never learns anything? Or worse? What if he finds out something awful?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be with him. Wherever this leads, I promise you I’m not going to let him go too far.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP BARTLETT
utterance.content: Long time, Rick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Phil Bartlett. Thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: Well, I knew it was only a matter of time before I’d hear from you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were expecting my call?

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: Of course I was. And I – I’m here for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God. What a relief. Okay. I need to talk to you about Thailand.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: What do you know about Thailand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was there. I saw you.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: You’re not supposed to know. Nobody is. And you can’t tell anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I won’t. I won’t. I promise. As long as you tell me your version of what happened.

utterance.speaker: BARLETT
utterance.content: I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I need to know what you know.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: What I’m about to say can never be repeated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Understood.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: I was in Thailand to attend an investment conference. We hit this Bangkok nightclub. God, she was so beautiful. I thought she was a woman, I swear to God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, what? Um, no. I need you to tell me about Chiang Mai.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: I was never in Chiang Mai. I was in Bangkok. You said you saw me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. But I didn’t see that.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: I think it’s best that we never speak of this again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. No, no. You were there. I know you were.

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: Look, I don’t know what kind of game you’re playing here –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not a game. I saw our trophy. The one we won for debate club. You were expecting my call. Why would you be expecting my call?

utterance.speaker: BARTLETT
utterance.content: Phillip Bartlett, Bartlett and Braddock Wealth Management. We wanted to take you on as a client. Now not so much. For the record, I was never a debate geek. I played lacrosse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t make any sense. He has to be part of this. He was in the dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except we checked him out. The first and only time Phil Bartlett traveled to Thailand was a month ago, and there’s nothing that connects him to all of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I even called Faircroft Prep. They confirmed that Phillip Bartlett was not on the debate team. I didn’t share first place with anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, babe, maybe you’re taking this whole dream thing too literally. Or maybe you’ve combined two memories together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I’m not making this up. But what if … what if this is Total Recall? Not only did they erase my memories but they replaced them with false memories. But the false memories would have to be based in reality, right? Otherwise why would Phil Bartlett be in them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Castle, listen –

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? A word?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve noticed you’ve devoted resources to running a background check on Phillip Bartlett. And tracing license plates in Thailand?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Sir, I was following up on some new leads on Castle’s disappearance.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: In connection to Chuck Norris?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Kate, I know how important this is to him. But these leads, are they solid? Or is Mr. Castle just grasping at straws?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I dug into that tattoo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That insignia. That means Delta Force, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s also the title of a Chuck Norris movie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now, Delta guys don’t advertise, so whoever’s wearing that ink is no longer active duty. Says here on the banner that he’s out of the 75th Ranger Regiment, 3rd Battalion, B company. Now, I checked with my boy at the Pentagon and there’s only a handful of guys with that service history who match the guy you said you saw. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for this, Esposito. This is great. So he will be in here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but he’s not.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: None of those guys look like Chuck Norris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t believe me, do you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: For my money, your story about the missing two months never added up. It still doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come – Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, this is the guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That guy looks nothing like Chuck Norris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He would with a beard. And he lives right here in the city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His name is Jeff Powers. Honorable discharge in 2009, then he worked as a contractor in Iraq and Afghanistan. This is just the kind of guy who could be a mercenary in Thailand. He was there. Beckett, he knows what happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hope so, but if he doesn’t then we need to take a breath and discuss how to pursue this. Or whether to pursue it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That won’t be necessary. All the answers are right behind this door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s okay. He knows me. Jeff Powers? It’s Rick Castle, from Thailand. Your door was unlocked. Just wanted to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s him. That’s the guy in my dream.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Well, needless to say, that GSW to the head is the likely cause of death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did this happen?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on liver temp, about midnight last night. But I’ll know more when I do a full workup on him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Castle starts remembering this guy and all of a sudden he becomes a homicide victim? That’s kind of weird.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s not just weird. It’s suspicious.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I was hoping to prove that Castle’s story was true, but not like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Yeah. Contact the next of kin. Let’s find out what Jeff Powers was into.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Easier said than done. His parents are dead, no wife or siblings. Hoping to track down a friend or someone he served with, but I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On the bright side, I’m not crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I never thought you were.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I sure thought I was. You must have had a few moments of doubt. We have any idea what killed him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s too soon to tell. But we’re going to get to the bottom of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if it’s my fault? What if me poking around is what got him killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, how could that even be possible?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe I’m being followed. Or watched. His death cannot be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. It doesn’t seem like one, does it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I may know more in twenty minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean your appointment with Dr. Burke?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. If I can remember about Thailand it may help us solve this murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Keep me close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, uh … Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Please tell me we’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I did find this. A cocktail napkin from Exotica.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I take it that’s a strip club?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And this was in the victim’s pocket. It could be where he was last night before he came home and wound up dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it might be where he met our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ll see if I can find out who he spent time with at Exotica.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Sure, I know Jeff. He was a regular. He’s at the club a few nights a week. He’s nice. Always a gentleman.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fact is, he was there last night. Right? Was he there with somebody?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Just me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Amber, did you notice if he talked to anyone or left with anyone?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Jeff wasn’t much for socializing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did he have any friends that you knew of? Did anybody ever stop by the club?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Yeah. One friend did.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Some Army buddy. He came in looking for Jeff. He was in town visiting and wanted to surprise him, so he made me swear not to say anything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When was this?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Three … days ago maybe?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Amber, this Army buddy of Jeff’s. Do you think you remember this guy well enough to help us out with a sketch?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Sure. Why? Is something going on with Jeff?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not working. I can’t remember anything new. I keep coming up with the same images.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Let’s look at this another way. Perhaps the images came to you for a reason. Something triggered them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: You began having this dream over a week ago. Did anything unusual occur on that particular day?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um… no. I got up, I had breakfast with Beckett. She had to go to court. I went to the gym.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: And then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wrote for a while. I wanted a change of scenery so – – I took my laptop to the coffee shop.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: There. What did you just remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just that when I was at the coffee shop I got this strange … um, like a buzzing, ringing in my ears.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Let’s go back a week ago to the coffee shop. What were you doing when this buzzing first started?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was writing. Or rather, procrastinating. I was stuck on a scene so I was just people watching.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Anyone you knew? Or recognized?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, I don’t think so. Wait a minute. That ringing? It started when I looked up at the TV.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: What was playing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something from the local news.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: This is the clip you would have seen.

utterance.speaker: NEWSCASTER
utterance.content: … but on the bright side, many post offices will be open extra late to accept tax returns from last minute filers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just some report on tax day. Maybe the buzzing has nothing to do with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just keep watching. There’s gotta be something else there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Um … pause it. Pause it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tory, zoom in on that man right there. I know him. He was the one chasing us in the truck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I’m sure. He was in Thailand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Got our sketch back of the guy who showed up at the strip club asking for Jeff Powers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the same man. First in Thailand, now in New York. Whoever he is, he’s at the center of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just catching a glimpse of his face is what started all this. It’s what triggered my dreams, but who is he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else do you remember about him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … he was dressed like a soldier.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said he was yelling at his men? In what language?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was speaking English.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So was he American? British?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I think he had an accent.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So European, maybe. I’ll run his photo through Interpol. See if they know him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll have unis canvass where that video was taken, see if anyone in that neighborhood recognizes him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks, guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. What else can we do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you can’t be a part of this. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean? I have to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know this man’s agenda.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. Beckett, I need to be –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What you need to do is go back to the loft and stay there. Now, I’ve assigned a security detail to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would I be a target?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. And neither do you. But he was shooting at you in Thailand. And he just killed Jeff Powers, your Chuck Norris lookalike. Now, LT is going to drive you home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if I refuse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then he’ll drive you home in handcuffs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just for the record: extremely bitter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll call you if we find anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, hey. What’d you find?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, for one thing, Mr. Powers’ bloodwork came back. He had antibodies for dengue fever.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just like Castle.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Similar strain, too. But the main attraction is what I found in the man’s mouth.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Or rather, what you didn’t find.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened to his teeth?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: They were pried out. Eight of them, shortly before he died.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Powers was tortured first. Revenge?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or the killer wanted information. Did he leave any evidence behind?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m afraid not. Looks like he wore latex gloves. I found traces of talc in the victim’s mouth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The gloves would have been bloody. The killer would have to get rid of them. They could have his prints or DNA on them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right, but those gloves could be anywhere. How are we going to find them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The department has bloodhounds. Call the K9 unit. Have them deploy bloodhounds to search by Powers’ apartment building.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Find the gloves yet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Eh. Nothing so far.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, not with my team either.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One of the dogs might still come through.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not so sure. For all we know the killer didn’t even toss his gloves.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, what? He’s just walking around with bloody latex?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, he could have put them in a Ziploc bag. He could have burned them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. The thing of it is, even if we find the gloves and get the killer’s prints or DNA and we do ID this guy, he’s probably long gone by now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Based on what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, if he wanted information he probably got it from Jeff Powers, yanking out all his teeth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Soldier like Powers? His training? No, he’d die before he spilled his guts.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hope you’re wrong about that. Because if the killer was after information? He may think Castle has it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I thought you said you were staying at a friend’s tonight.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, uh … you said I was staying at a friend’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well then, you should have listened.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I wanted to be here with you. I know this isn’t just another case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, listen, yesterday morning in my office, I know I was a little … Doc Brown, Back to the Future.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What really went on in Thailand, Dad? I know you must have a theory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, believe me. I have dozens.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Which one scares you the most? I don’t need you to protect me. I’m not a kid anymore. I’m not afraid to hear the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right, you aren’t, are you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why not let me in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wanted to forget everything. So in my darkest moments I wonder … if I did something terrible.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know you. You would never do anything bad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I could never leave the love of my life, desert her and you for two months. And somehow I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did we ID this guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: By way of a bloodhound named Cujo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Cujo sniffed out a paper bag in a storm drain about four blocks away from the crime scene. The bag contained latex gloves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we’re sure these gloves belonged to the killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. The bag had teeth in it, too. In any case, CSU was able to pull prints.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got a hit off of ECRUS. European fingerprint network.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer’s European?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s Russian. Ilya Golovkin. Castle, does that name sound familiar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Who is he?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He served in Spetsnaz, Russian special forces. They moved on to the former KGB.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Russians are behind this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doubtful. He left Russia five years ago and disappeared.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Since then, word is he’s been responsible for over two dozen assassinations.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Including politicians, dissident journalists, protected witnesses, even a Vatican banker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Golovkin’s the guy you call when you have a job no one else can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if Golovkin’s involved then whatever’s going on, whatever you were a part of, it’s something big.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do we even track down a guy like Golovkin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We called in reinforcements. We’re coordinating with the FBI. Every state and federal law enforcement agency is looking for this guy, and when we find him you will have your answers. He’s the only person who knows the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s at least one other person who knows. I need to see Powers’ file.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly what are you hoping to find? We already went over what little there is on Powers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. But you were looking for his killer. I’m looking for this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jenkins is the mastermind behind this. Or mastermind adjacent. He was probably in Thailand. For all I know he was driving the truck I was in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we could never locate Jenkins, much less find his real name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But maybe now we can. If Jenkins had contact with Powers there may be evidence in here that can lead us to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We got a hit off that APB. Transit cop thinks he just saw Golovkin get off a subway stop at Sheridan Square.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s half a block from Jeff Powers’ apartment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe he went back there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stay put, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You be careful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will. ESU’s got my back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The seal is cut. Someone went inside.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He might still be there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s Amber. The stripper. Golovkin must have questioned her. Now he knows we’re on to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bringing her here was his way of rubbing our faces in it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but what’s his angle? What’s he after?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. But whatever it is, he’s not going to stop until he gets it.

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: Good evening, sir. How may I help you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I’m working with the NYPD. I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions. Have you ever seen this man?

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: Mr. Jeff. Of course. He’s a regular customer here at Sunil’s Café.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really regular. In fact, over the past six months he’s come here without fail every Tuesday at 6PM. Was he meeting anyone?

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: No. He always dines alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about this man? Have you ever seen him? Or the two of them together?

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: No. He’s not familiar to me. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Thank you for your time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BILAL KHAN
utterance.content: You should never have come. If you’re here, that means that I’m a dead man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you already were a dead man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You’re not going anywhere until you tell me what the hell’s going on.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Fine. We must leave. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’re we going? What is this place?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: They promised me you wouldn’t remember. How did you find me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jeff Powers.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Powers would never talk. Unless … … he’s dead, isn’t he? When?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Was it the Russian?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know about the Russian? How?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: This is worse than I thought.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you calling?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: This is Icarus. I’ve got a code 791.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does that mean? Just – tell me who you are.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: I’m Bilal. Bilal Khan. You really don’t know me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you were in the truck, wounded.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Long before that I was your friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: I was an exchange student at Faircroft Prep in eleventh grade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You weren’t. I’d remember that.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Not anymore. You see? The two of us, together. The good old days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the trophy. The one I thought I won with Phil Bartlett.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: That’s because they had to erase all your memories of me and replace them with someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are they?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: I can’t believe they picked Phil Bartlett. What a douchebag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, Bilal. It’s Bilal, right? Even if what you said is true, and we knew each other in eleventh grade –

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: You even consulted with me when you wrote your first Derrick Storm book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Consulted about what?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Terrorism. Since I was working with Pakistani intelligence I was something of an expert on the topic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but how does that explain Jeff Powers? Why would he come to the restaurant every Tuesday?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: To check in with me. He was my handler. My CIA handler. And now my cover’s blown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your cover? So you’re a spy?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Not a spy. Look, after I left the intelligence service I lost my way. I joined Al-Qaida.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were in Al-Qaida?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Will you please keep your voice down? Yes, I was. I rose up to become part of the senior leadership.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now you’re bussing tables and you live here?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: I chose this life. It’s my penance. I wanted to leave Al-Qaida and I had inside knowledge about that organization. So I struck a deal with American intelligence to trade what I knew for a second chance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You defected.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: If you like. I hid in a Buddhist monastery in Thailand where I was supposed to meet my CIA contact and get safe passage to the United States. But things didn’t go as planned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now what does any of this have to do with me? Why was I there?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Because I needed you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Needed me? Needed me for what?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: I was about to turn myself over to the CIA when my contact was killed by a bullet that was meant for me. Now, the rendezvous point was supposed to be a secret, which means there was a leak. I could trust no one. I – I had some leverage so I agreed to meet again, but only in the company of somebody I trusted. Somebody I knew. Somebody too prominent to be eliminated. I knew only one such man. You.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did we end up in that truck?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: The Russian had been hunting me, hired by Al-Qaida. He finally caught up with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s how you got wounded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was I wounded, too?

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: Fortunately, no.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: My ride’s here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I still have a lot of questions.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: There’s no more time. I’m sorry, Rick. Look, I was the cause of much upheaval in your life. Please know that was never my intention. In fact, I have the deepest gratitude for everything that you’ve done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wish I could remember what it was.

utterance.speaker: BILAL
utterance.content: As do I. I doubt we’ll meet again. Be well.

utterance.speaker: ILYA GOLOVKIN
utterance.content: Come away from the light.

utterance.speaker: GOLOVKIN
utterance.content: Come.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I’m – I’m not part of this. I know absolutely nothing.

utterance.speaker: GOLOVKIN
utterance.content: It does not matter.

utterance.speaker: HENRY JENKINS
utterance.content: I thought we had an understanding - that you wouldn’t pursue this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jenkins.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Well, you’ll have to forget about Bilal Khan and everything else that’s occurred tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you going to help me to forget?

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: We’d prefer not to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, thank you for that. Oh, and uh –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s for making me miss my wedding day.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: You have no idea how lucky you are, Mr. Castle. As for missing your wedding, that was unavoidable, if it’s any consolation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not! You dragged me halfway across the world. You owe me an explanation.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: I’m not at liberty to give you one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, I’m not at liberty to forget about Bilal Khan or Golovkin here.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Mr. Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Are you going to kill me? You can’t. Raise too many questions. That’s why you brought me back from Thailand, minus my memory. I was gone two months, thanks to you. I missed my wedding. What couldn’t wait one more day?

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: There was a ticking clock. We picked up chatter about a major Al-Qaida strike in the US. We knew it was hours away and there was never enough time for us to put the pieces together in order to stop it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Bilal knew about the strike.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Names, places, operational details. We were desperate for Bilal and his intel, and when his contact was killed we needed you to get Bilal. And he came through. We were able to prevent the strike and we neutralized everyone involved. That’s all I can tell you. And I expect you not to repeat it.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Think of it this way: yeah, you missed your wedding. But you also saved tens of thousands of lives. You should leave now, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You saved tens of thousands of lives?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And went on a secret mission to Thailand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Unfortunately I cannot divulge any further specifics.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: If you told us you’d have to kill us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mock, but it is for your own safety.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I guess what really matters is you found out the truth, Dad. And the good news is it didn’t turn out to be your worst case scenario.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Bad news is I can’t brag about my heroic exploits to anyone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Though you’re kinda doing that right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Totally.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I have to go study.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See ya.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You know, darling, Alexis and I do not need to know the details. But I do hope you can tell Katherine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. I got here as soon as I could.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Never soon enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m just glad that you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … don’t tell Alexis or Mother about the Russian assassin part. I left that out of the story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, um … there’s no proof of what happened in that alley. By the time uniforms got there his body was already gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Jenkins can get rid of memories, getting rid of a body would be child’s play. I am so sorry, Kate, for everything I put you through.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, it’s not like you were partying in Thailand. You have the best excuse ever for missing our wedding. You were saving the world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Still a lot of unanswered questions, though. Like, how did I get shot? Why was I gone for two months?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. You may not know everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But I know enough. Let’s drink to that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.
